column4: my karmic koala ( fresh install ) disconnects me from my ssh server :|
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent
Read from socket failed: Connection reset by peer
this being the messages I get when using -v
http://pastebin.com/d6e957d40 ( sshd problem :| )
grgl .. what the heck is wrong with the sshd :| I just did a openssh-server .. I expected it to just work ..
you don't launch sshd like that
I know.
sshd is started via /etc/init.d/ssh start
sorry, I missunderstood what you where saying, I though you where saying that's how you where trying to start it
I've not seen a log
wat is your problem ?
http://pastebin.com/d6e957d40
can you pastebin your /etc/ssh/sshd_config please
erUSUL, it seems it only does that on a non-default port, works just fine on 22, however, if I modify /etc/ssh/sshd_config Port=5522 .. won't work
it looks like it's trying to connect on ipv6
no problem 'bout that .. it's localhost ..
disable the ubuntu firewall for starters while debugging
no firewall
it's localhost on ipv6 - the firewall rules may not be blocking it
have you disabled the default iptables firewall ?
erUSUL http://pastebin.com/d9d46d92
however, setting "Port 22" in sshd_config works just great ! :|
